job_description:
Vidoori is a leading provider of digital transformation and technology solutions, empowering organisations across multiple industries to accelerate business value and innovation. As part of our ongoing expansion, we are recruiting a talented, analytical, and collaborative Business Analyst (Mid-Level) who is passionate about driving business improvement through data, technology, and stakeholder engagement. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are ready to take your business analysis career to the next level, we welcome you to join our inclusive and progressive team.

Business Analysis and Digital Transformation – Role Overview

As a Business Analyst at Vidoori, you will play a crucial role in gathering, analysing, and documenting business requirements to support technology-enabled project delivery. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will translate business needs into actionable insights and specifications that enable successful digital solutions. This position is ideal for someone with proven analytical skills and a drive to support organisational change in a values-led workplace.

Key Responsibilities – Business Process, Requirements Gathering, And Stakeholder Management
• Work with stakeholders to elicit, analyse, and document business, functional, and technical requirements for a range of technology and transformation projects.
• Facilitate workshops, interviews, and meetings to understand current business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and define future-state workflows.
• Develop use cases, process maps, and requirement specifications to support effective solution design and project delivery.
• Collaborate with product owners, developers, testers, and subject matter experts throughout the project lifecycle to ensure requirements alignment and traceability.
• Perform gap analyses and support business process reengineering to help drive operational efficiency and value realisation.
• Assist with change management, user acceptance testing (UAT), and the implementation of business solutions, supporting stakeholder readiness and adoption.
• Contribute to continuous improvement of business analysis methodologies and knowledge sharing across the team.

Essential Skills And Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Finance, or a related field.
• 3–5 years’ experience as a business analyst within technology, consulting, finance, or a comparable environment.
• Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities.
• Demonstrated experience with requirements elicitation, documentation, and business process mapping tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, BPMN).
• Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills, with a collaborative and inclusive approach to teamwork.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and experience with Agile, Scrum, or other modern project delivery frameworks.
• Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deliver high-quality work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
• Exposure to digital, finance, or technology transformation projects is preferred but not essential.

Benefits and Professional Growth – Business Analysis Careers at Vidoori
• Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits to support personal and career growth.
• Flexible, hybrid and remote working options to foster work–life balance and wellbeing.
• Ongoing mentoring, skills development, and training opportunities to accelerate your business analysis expertise.
• An inclusive, innovative company culture celebrating diversity, teamwork, and lifelong learning.
• Defined career pathways to more senior business analysis or project management roles, as your skills and interests evolve.

Application Details – Business Analyst Opportunities at Vidoori
• Location: Hybrid – Maryland/Washington DC Area
• Residency: Must be a US Citizen
• Employment Type: Full-time

Advance your business analysis career with Vidoori—where your curiosity, insight, and collaborative approach will drive success for our clients and your professional journey. Apply today to become a valued contributor to transformative business and technology projects.

job_description:
Job Title: Senior Functional Business Analyst

Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: None

Type of Travel: None
• * *

The Opportunity:

CACI is hiring multiple Senior Functional Business Systems Analysts to join our growing Financial Management Business Transformation (FMBT) Systems Integration (SI) Team supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). This is an opportunity to work on a high-impact federal modernization initiative replacing legacy financial management systems with a modern COTS product.

• We are seeking candidates with 6-10 years’ experience in federal financial accounting and ERP systems implementation experience.
• Applicants must have prior work experience ideally with Momentum Financials or similar COTS ﬁnancial ERP systems (e.g., SAP or Oracle).

Responsibilities:
• Lead requirements gathering sessions with client stakeholders and subject matter experts.
• Analyze current business processes, identify gaps, and develop comprehensive business requirements
• Own gap analysis efforts, mapping business requirements to Momentum Financials functionality
• Participate and facilitate Agile ceremonies (stand-ups, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and PI planning)
• Track, document, and manage changes to business requirements throughout project lifecycle
• Manage functional area or module ownership ( e.g. AP, AR, Budget)
• Present findings, recommendations, and solutions to senior client stakeholders and management
• Manage dependencies and risks to meet time estimates, and schedules for project execution.
• Clearly and professionally communicate with client and management during requirements gathering and throughout project lifecycle.

Qualifications:

Required:

○ US citizenship is required.
○ Bachelor’s Degree or Associates/Vocational/Technical education or equivalent work experience.
○ 6-10 years of experience in business analysis, ERP implementation, or federal financial systems.
○ Strong expertise in Agile methodologies.
○ Proven ability to lead requirements gathering sessions and facilitating workshops.
○ Must have the ability to pass a Public Trust background investigation.
○ Strong analytical and written and oral communication skills.
○ Ability to work both independently and with a team to solve problems.
○ Ability to eﬃciently and eﬀectively handle multiple and shifting priorities while meeting deadlines.
○ Willingness to work onsite with client partners

Desired:

○ Experience working with the Momentum Financials front-end and database.
○ Understanding of Agile methodologies.
○ Experience with requirement management tools (Jira, Agility, VersionOne, Confluence)
○ Understanding of Agile methodologies.
○ Ability to learn or write and execute SQL statements.

This position is contingent on funding and may not be filled immediately. However, this position is representative of positions within CACI that are consistently available. Individuals who apply may also be considered for other positions at CACI.

_________________________________________________________________________

What You Can Expect:

A culture of integrity.

At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.

CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

A focus on continuous growth.

Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.

_________________________________________________________________________

Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits.

Since this position can be worked in more than one location, the range shown is the national average for the position.

$75,200-$158,100

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Workplace Analytics, Global Workplace Services
job_description:
Senior Business Analyst - Workplace Analytics, Global Workplace Services

At Capital One, we dare to dream, disrupt and deliver a better way. Our goal is simple—bring ingenuity, simplicity and humanity to an industry ripe for change. Our Global Workplace Services (GWS) team is a dynamic organization where development matters as much as our ability to provide collaborative and secure environments that drive connection, innovation and business success. Our commitment extends beyond solutions; it embraces a culture of care. We value, celebrate and respect each teammate's unique talents, experience, and contributions.

In GWS, our team manages a diverse portfolio of mixed-use owned and leased properties. We’re constantly transforming our workplace to enable our employees to work the way they work best. But it doesn’t stop there. We don’t just reimagine and create fabulous spaces and amenities, we also manage and operate them and ensure the safety and security of our employees and the community—we’re a well-oiled machine! That’s why our team is looking to add a Senior Business Analyst.

As a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. You will contribute in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation. Analysts who are familiar with commercial real estate and are passionate about how real estate influences culture and the environment will be better positioned to thrive in GWS.

General Responsibilities:
• Analysis: Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations
• Product: Perform modeling/analytics to assist new product and pricing strategies for various lending products
• Marketing: Support direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Help build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go to market strategies
• Credit Risk: Support step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis
• Execution: Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan
• Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability
• Strategic & analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation, given that a large part of the business is based on rigorous analytic marketing & credit risk management
• Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: He/she should be a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business
• Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills
• Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals. He/she should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment
• Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)
• At least 1 year of experience in analysis

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering
• 1+ years of experience in Statistical model building
• 1+ years of experience in market research
• 1+ years of experience in SQL querying
• 2+ years of experience in business analysis
• 1+ years of experience in consulting

Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

McLean, VA: $111,200 - $126,900 for Sr. Business Analyst

Richmond, VA: $101,100 - $115,400 for Sr. Business Analyst

Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate’s offer letter.

This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan.

Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.

This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.

No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer (EOE, including disability/vet) committed to non-discrimination in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.

If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. FLEX Project Manager / Business Analyst, ITSM Reporting and Analytics

Marriott International has an exciting opportunity for a FLEX Project Manager / Business Analyst on the Enterprise ITSM Reporting and Analytics team. This dual role is part of a team focused on building, managing, and performing delivery of actionable reporting as part of the Enterprise ITSM Reporting and Analytics team supporting Marriott’s Global Technology operations teams. Our team goal is to provide meaningful data to the business in order to drive continual improvement of technology delivery and service for the benefit of our customers.

The successful candidate will have the following competencies :
• Be able to perform a dual role as both a Project Manager and a Business Analyst, with responsibility for managing ITSM reporting projects, building data definitions, gathering requirements, and managing the workflow of our high-performing reporting team
• Experience with managing and / or deploying ITSM and ITIL related operations projects with a take charge attitude and a strong drive for success
• Have a passion for data and analytics technologies
• Ability to resolve complex issues and provide input for decisions
• Collaborate on multiple projects with multiple stakeholders to ensure successful completion
• Be able to act as a Scrum Master for the reporting team and potentially other practice teams to drive work management

Education and Experience

Required :
• 5+ years’ experience in IT project management implementing enterprise data capabilities and products
• Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
• Experience defining and implementing ITSM Metric governance
• Experience leading complex data initiatives with multiple stakeholders and end users including both technical and non-technical partners.
• Demonstrated record of managing projects from inception to successful implementation.
• Ability to build positive and collaborative relationships with stakeholders at multiple levels
• Experience collecting requirements, building work management processes, and building metric definitions
• Ability to write technical documentation

Preferred Skills and Expertise :
• Experience with Atlassian (JIRA / Confluence)
• Experience with managing SharePoint sites
• Experience with Service Now reporting platform
• Experience with both PowerBI and cloud data warehouse services
• Experience running Scrum with familiarity with Kanban
• Proficiency in data audit and enforcing data standards
• Experience defining and implementing data governance process
• PMP or CBAP certification (nice to have)

job_title: Business Analyst Intern, NA Integrated Analytics (2026 Summer - New York)
job_description:
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

How can we promote longer and healthier lives? Armed with decades of risk data, novel data sources, and a team of innovative data scientists, engineers, and domain experts, Munich RE is building solutions that are transforming the life insurance industry.
• Develop solutions that allow easier access to insurance and healthier lifestyles
• Build highly scalable products with best security, ML, DevOps practices Research bias and fairness, disease models, NLP & more
• Discover diverse careers with leadership opportunities
• Flexible remote/in-person work + focus on work-life balance
• Be part of a fast-growing team that values transparency & diversity

Our internships provide you with an excellent opportunity to practically apply your classroom and technical training in the reinsurance industry. While with our team, you’ll be: coached by experienced industry professionals, exposed to Munich Re leadership, challenged as a valuable team member and contributor doing meaningful work, and mentored to develop a solid foundation that will help position you as a future leader in the field.

Munich Re is operating under a hybrid working model, including an average of 3 days in office/week with the remaining days working from home. Students are expected to relocate to the city in which they work for the duration of their internship, so they can fully benefit from the full program integration. This provides a great opportunity to network, develop soft skills and become immersed within the greater Munich Re culture; including engaging with your team while in-office for face-to-face meetings, sharing meaningful moments, and allocating time to connect with your Manager.

To learn more about the North American Integrated Analytics team, please visit our site:

https://www.munichre.com/us-life/en/solutions/integrated-analytics.html

THE ROLE:

Responsibilities may include, but will not be limited to the following:
• Supporting technical implementation with clients, including client-facing and internal process flows, requirements gathering and validation, and documentation
• Promote client satisfaction by providing insights to ensure clients get the most out of our platforms, investigate and solve problems raised by clients, document client feedback and share with sales and leadership
• Support the product lifecycle by collaborating with our risk specialists and data scientists to plan, develop, and implement new features and platform improvements.
• Support testing and implementation of new features with clients to ensure accuracy and avoid disruption
• Collaborate across Munich Re functions to understand how our solutions address business needs
• Network with related groups at Munich Re

QUALIFICATIONS:

We’re looking for well-rounded individuals who are technically astute, have strong communication skills, and demonstrate the ability to build positive relationships with internal clients. We’re seeking energetic and collaborative professionals who are excited to join our winning team and show promise of becoming a future leader in the data science space.

Specifically, we’re looking for the following qualifications:

Technical:
• Undergraduate or Graduate degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent
• Strong analytical, organizational, and time management skills
• Ability to express complex ideas clearly and facilitate communication between clients and internal teams
• Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., Microsoft Azure, AWS)
• Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Power BI, SQL
• Experience with software engineering best practices

Behavioral:
• Solid communication skills; spoken & written, formal/informal presentation
• Resourceful and able to learn quickly
• Proven ability to thrive in a dynamic environment.

Preferred (but not required):
• Previous exposure to insurance or financial services environment

Note that this opportunity is open to current students who are returning to in-class studies upon the completion of the internship.

Qualifications: We’re looking for well-rounded individuals who are technically astute, have strong communication skills, and demonstrate the ability to build positive relationships with internal clients

job_title: Financial Business Analyst – Pricing & Commercial Analytics (100% Remote)
job_description:
Company Overview

Korn Ferry has partnered with a leading firm looking for a candidate that can sit 100% remote in eastern or central time zone.

A national professional services firm providing consulting, engineering, and infrastructure-related solutions across public and private sector markets. With a broad geographic footprint and diverse service offerings, the organization partners with clients to address complex operational, environmental, and infrastructure challenges, with a strong emphasis on sustainability and long-term value creation.

Role Summary

The Financial Business Analyst will support the development, governance, and ongoing management of an enterprise pricing model and growth strategy. Reporting to Finance leadership and working closely with Commercial Operations, the Project Management Office (PMO), and cross-functional stakeholders, this role will help maintain and enhance pricing tools, monitor key performance metrics, evaluate deals, and provide analytical insights that support strategic decision-making.

The ideal candidate is highly analytical, detail-oriented, and motivated to grow their commercial and financial skillset within a fast-paced, project-based professional services environment.

Key Responsibilities

Pricing Model Management & Governance
• Maintain and update pricing databases, assumptions, and driver tables to ensure data accuracy and consistency
• Analyze historical pricing data to identify trends, inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvement
• Structure data to support win-theme analysis, predictive pricing, and ongoing model enhancements
• Prepare pricing analyses, margin summaries, and variance reports to support pricing strategy rollout and governance
• Expand pricing models and tools to incorporate additional service lines and practice areas
• Track non-standard pricing requests and maintain documentation of approvals and outcomes
• Monitor adherence to pricing guardrails and escalate deviations as appropriate
• Support onboarding and integration of newly acquired businesses or services into the enterprise pricing framework

Analytics & KPI Reporting
• Build and maintain dashboards and reports tracking pricing performance, deal quality, discounting behavior, and margin attainment
• Prepare recurring pricing KPI reports for Sales, Finance, Operations, and Executive Leadership
• Conduct ad hoc analyses to support pricing strategy updates, margin improvement initiatives, and leadership requests

Forecasting & Scenario Analysis
• Model the financial impact of pricing changes on win rates, revenue, and profitability
• Translate analytical findings into clear insights and executive-ready summaries

Sales & Commercial Partnership
• Provide analytical support during proposal development and deal evaluation
• Research competitive benchmarks and market pricing trends to inform commercial strategy
• Contribute to continuous improvement of pricing governance and commercial operations processes
• Document best practices and maintain a centralized pricing knowledge repository

Cross-Functional Collaboration
• Partner with Operations to ensure accurate project data flows into pricing and profitability reporting
• Collaborate with IT and Analytics teams to improve data automation, dashboards, and web-based pricing tools
• Support PMO leadership with data analysis for project reviews, performance monitoring, and execution insights
• Assist Commercial Operations leadership with pricing strategy development and performance modeling

Core Competencies
• Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to work with complex data sets, extract insights, and communicate findings clearly
• Strategic Pricing & Business Acumen: Understands how pricing decisions impact broader organizational goals and financial performance
• Attention to Detail: Maintains high standards for data accuracy across systems and analyses
• Collaboration & Influence: Effectively partners with Sales, Finance, and Operations to guide pricing and commercial decisions
• Curiosity & Growth Mindset: Demonstrates interest in understanding the business and continuously building commercial expertise

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, or a related field
• 4+ years of experience in pricing, financial analysis, or business analytics
• Experience in professional services or project-based environments preferred
• Advanced Excel proficiency required; experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Domo) preferred
• Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills
• Ability to clearly communicate insights and support data-driven decision-making

job_description:
We’re building a world of health around every individual — shaping a more connected, convenient and compassionate health experience. At CVS Health®, you’ll be surrounded by passionate colleagues who care deeply, innovate with purpose, hold ourselves accountable and prioritize safety and quality in everything we do. Join us and be part of something bigger – helping to simplify health care one person, one family and one community at a time.

Position Summary
This position encompasses the role of an advisory-level business analyst within the Network Standards department. The position focuses on business, functional, and technical requirements management through the project life cycle; from requirements gathering through implementation. In addition to business-initiated enhancement efforts, the Advisor business analyst is expected to fully review departmental business processes and proactively identify opportunities for improvement, such as automation. The Advisor business analyst performs requirements-gathering, creates documentation, conducts unit tests, and oversees user-acceptance testing on application development initiatives. The position requires productive communication with our business partners to improve service delivery and product enhancement efforts, proactively driving requirements meetings and actively proposing solutions. The Advisor business analyst assists in training business partners on new application functionalities and performs application support by logging and researching reported system issues. The position requires the ability to identify and record value metrics related to application enhancements to report back on business value delivered. The Advisor business analyst will leverage their in-depth business analysis and project management skills to deliver successful end-user products with timely and smooth implementations. They will support the full Software Development Life Cycle and be flexible to play any of the following roles depending on project/application: Business Analyst, Project Manager, and QA/UAT Lead.

Responsibilities:
• Identifies stakeholders and conducts interviews to gather business requirements via workshops. Builds process flows, workflows, and data flows to represent the current and future state of business processes. Creates requirements documents, user-story maps, and user-stories to provide direction to development team. Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards. Identify business, operational, and technical tasks, scope, time constraints and task interdependencies. Leads walkthrough of business requirements and design reviews.
• Ensures that the current and proposed Network Technology business process flows are complete and accurate to ensure that product development aligns with business goals and objectives.
• Contributes to the Network Technology product design through effective interfacing with the development team (by project). Conducts design reviews between our business partners and the development team; including participating in design reviews for other projects lead by other BAs.
• Drives projects to completion both on-time and on budget. Sets project goals and generates project documentation. Proactively identifies and communicates issues that may jeopardize milestones or project budget to Network Technology leadership.
• Manages product testing by developing test cases and coordinating QAT & UAT sessions to ensure all issues have been corrected before deployment. Acts as the liaison between the business and developers to ensure quick and accurate issue resolution.
• Ensures that Network Technology document repositories, training materials, and user documentation to support implementation activities are updated and current.
• Establish standards for technical documentation and user documentation. Implement best practices and consistent methodologies as it applies to: requirements gathering, project management, QAT and UAT, and product implementation. Provides oversight on documentation of business requirements across the Network Technology BA group through peer reviews.

Required Qualifications
• 5+ years experience in business analysis or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications
• A minimum of 8 years experience in business analysis or a related field.
• Knowledge of pharmacy network operations and adjudication processes across CVS Caremark platforms is desired.
• Knowledge of client set up activities and claims processing flow.
• Experience with MS Office tools (Word, Excel, Visio)
• Experience with Web based applications
• Experience with Caremark data warehouses and analysis tools.
• Knowledge of SharePoint and SQL Reporting Services.
• Familiarity with PBM business model (plans, programs, and practices) as well as pharmaceutical practices (nomenclature, medications)
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal communication/social skills and the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
• Excellent analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
• Ability to produce concise, clear, and complete business requirements.
• Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
• Serve as a liaison between the business owner and the development team to provide technical solutions.
• Ability to negotiate effort scope and commitments by facilitating communication between business and development teams.
• Ability to work independently and to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
• Ability to take project ownership and guide efforts through to deployment. Project management expertise.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, including Microsoft Visio.
• A history of leading and supporting successful projects.
• Ability to mentor and coach others.

Education
• Bachelor's degree or relevant professional experience required

Anticipated Weekly Hours
40

Time Type
Full time

Pay Range

The typical pay range for this role is:

$92,700.00 - $185,400.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

Our people fuel our future. Our teams reflect the customers, patients, members and communities we serve and we are committed to fostering a workplace where every colleague feels valued and that they belong.

Great benefits for great people

We take pride in our comprehensive and competitive mix of pay and benefits – investing in the physical, emotional and financial wellness of our colleagues and their families to help them be the healthiest they can be. In addition to our competitive wages, our great benefits include:
• Affordable medical plan options, a 401(k) plan (including matching company contributions), and an employee stock purchase plan.
• No-cost programs for all colleagues including wellness screenings, tobacco cessation and weight management programs, confidential counseling and financial coaching.
• Benefit solutions that address the different needs and preferences of our colleagues including paid time off, flexible work schedules, family leave, dependent care resources, colleague assistance programs, tuition assistance, retiree medical access and many other benefits depending on eligibility.

For more information, visit https://jobs.cvshealth.com/us/en/benefits

We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/31/2026

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.

job_description:
ROLE SUMMARY

In support of the Connected Vehicle Development and Delivery team, plays a pivotal role in aligning business needs with technical solutions to deliver efficient and innovative connected vehicle services. Supports technical systems solutions, integrations, and services across various markets, with a focus on global scalability. In this visible role, collaborates with both internal and external Business Analysts (BAs) to transform vision into technical reality. Maintains dedication to developing and maintaining high-quality, reliable, scalable, and secure software solutions that exceed customer expectations.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
• Technical Focus:
• Concentrates on the integration and optimization of systems.
• Focuses on global scalability and complex integrations.
• Review and Understand User Stories: Reviews user stories created by the Business Analyst (BA) and collaborates with the BA to understand the business context and objectives.
• Identify Technical Stories: Translates business requirements into technical stories, identifying systems, software, and technologies while considering system integrations, data flow, security, and performance.
• Create Technical Stories: Creates refined technical stories for technical functions considering system integrations, data flow, security, and performance.
• Collaborate with Stakeholders: Collaborates with stakeholders, including the BA and development teams, and to gather additional insights and to clarify ambiguities to ensure a shared understanding of requirements and technical constraints.
• Refine User Stories: Refines user stories by adding technical details and specifications, defining acceptance criteria, technical tasks, and dependencies while breaking down complex user stories into smaller, manageable tasks.
• Create Detailed Documentation: Documents refined user stories, including technical requirements and specifications serving as a guide for the team; maintains a comprehensive knowledge base and documentation repository.
• Validate and Prioritize: Validates refined user stories with stakeholders; prioritizes and organizes stories within sprints.
• Release Management:
• Documents and communicating release scope, including detailed release schedules and key milestones.
• Owns release activities, including release plans, user acceptance testing (UAT) schedules, go/no-go reviews, knowledge transfer sessions for operations, and release notes distributions.
• Conducts post-release retrospectives to evaluate success and identify improvements.
• Agile Participation: Actively participates in Agile ceremonies; provides technical story guidance and clarifications.
• Issue Investigation: Investigates and identifies issues with software or systems; develops remediation solution options.
• Requirement Fulfillment: Ensures that systems meet business and technical needs.
• Cross-Team Coordination: Facilitates alignment and coordination across technical teams.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
• Technology Research: Coordinates technology research and estimations.
• Meeting Facilitation: Chairs and facilitates meetings where appropriate and distributes minutes.
• Training and Mentorship: Provides training and mentorship as needed.
• Continuous Improvement: Identifies opportunities for process improvements and contributes to the development of best practices.
• Quality Assurance: Participates in quality assurance activities.

REQUIRED SKILLS & PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS
• Strong ability to analyze business requirements and translate them into technical specifications and technical stories.
• Proficiency in conceptual understanding of databases, programming languages, software development life cycles, system architectures, and data modeling.
• Ability to identify issues, develop remediation solutions, and troubleshoot problems.
• Experience in planning and coordinating release activities.
• Familiarity with Agile practices and participation in Agile ceremonies.
• Skilled in creating detailed documentation for business requirements including technical specifications, technical stories, user stories, and operational processes.
• Proven ability to facilitate alignment and coordination across technical teams to ensure cohesive and integrated solutions.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Effective time management and ability to drive multiple projects simultaneously.
• Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.
• Competent with JIRA and Confluence preferred.
• Experience supporting telematics or connected vehicle technologies preferred.
• Experience with Waterfall, Agile SCRUM, and Kanban methodologies, demonstrating versatility in managing projects through iterative and structured approaches preferred.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, business, or related field required Master's Degree such as Masters in Business Administration (MBA) or other relevant advanced degree preferred. Relevant experience accepted in lieu of a degree. At least 4 to 6 years required.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
• Office Location: Camden, NJ apart of the Greater Philadelphia Area (Philly)
• Hybrid Role: Remote work 2 days per week (After 90 Days) [Wednesdays & Fridays]
• Internal Work Environment: Prolonged sitting at desk and computer.
• Physical Demands: Occasionally lifts and moves computing equipment up to 75 lbs.
• Travel Required: 5% Internationally and Domestically

COMPENSATION: The recruiting base salary range for this full-time position is $88000 - $120000/year. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. (Internal Job Grade: P2_T) In addition to competitive salary, Subaru offers an amazing benefits package that includes:
• Medical, Dental, Vision Plans
• Pension, Profit Sharing, and 401K Match Offerings
• 15 Vacation days, 9 Company Holidays, 5 Floating Holidays, and 5 Sick days.
• Tuition Reimbursement Program
• Vehicle Discount Programs

Visit our Careers landing page for additional information about our compensation and benefit programs.

ABOUT SUBARU

LOVE. It’s what makes Subaru, Subaru®. As a leading auto brand in the US, we strive to be More Than a Car Company®. Subaru believes in being a positive force in the communities in which we live and work, not just with donations but with actions that set an example for others to follow. That’s what we call our Subaru Love Promise®.

Subaru is a globally renowned automobile manufacturer known for its commitment to innovation, safety, and sustainability. With a rich history dating back to 1953, Subaru has consistently pushed the boundaries of automotive engineering to deliver vehicles that offer not only exceptional performance but also a unique blend of utility and adventure.

Subaru's company culture is built on collaboration, diversity, and a shared passion for our product. We foster an inclusive environment that encourages employees to bring their unique perspectives and talents to the table. Our team members are driven by a common goal: to create exceptional vehicles that inspire and delight our customers.

job_title: Technology Business Systems Analyst - People Technology
job_description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they are doing. At Dutch Bros Coffee, we are more than just a coffee company. We are a fun-loving, mind-blowing company that makes a difference one cup at a time.

Position Overview:

As Dutch Bros continues its incredible growth, the teams building our future are more critical than ever. We are looking for a technical, problem-solving Technology Business Analyst to own and advance the systems that power our People Technology Team. You will act as a primary technology partner, automating processes and delivering actionable insights to drive business success across these critical functions. You will be the go-to technology partner for helping the organization fully leverage Workday while continuously advancing and maturing our other People Technology systems to ensure our tools are as high-performing as our people.

Job Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a quantitative field.
• 3–5+ years in business systems analysis, HRIS architecture, or a similar technical role.
• Proficiency in Workday reporting tools, data visualization (BI tools), and AI-powered automation.
• Effective prioritization, change management, functional expertise, and strong communication.

Location Requirement:
This role is located in Tempe, Arizona. This position is required to be in office 4 days per week (Mon-Thurs); Fridays are optional remote work days.

Key Result Areas (KRAs):
• Support & Maturation of People Systems: Provide comprehensive technical support for the entire People Technology ecosystem. This includes maintaining system stability, managing upgrades, and ensuring all HRIS and peripheral people tools are optimized to support the employee lifecycle.
• Workday Strategy & Optimization: Serve as the subject matter expert for Workday, identifying underutilized features and implementing configurations that maximize the platform's value for the organization.
• Data Analysis & Reporting: Extract and synthesize data using Python, R, or SQL to create dashboards, KPIs, and complex analytics for HR, payroll, and finance.
• Process Automation: Identify and implement intelligent automation—leveraging AI and Workday Prism—to accelerate workflows and enhance data integrity across Real Estate, Legal, and People teams.
• Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to translate business needs into technical requirements and manage backlogs of system requests.
• System Health & Integration: Troubleshoot database issues, configure system changes, and manage integrations between platforms to ensure seamless data flow.

Skills:
• Adaptable
• Initiative
• Collaborative
• Communication
• Effective Prioritization
• Functional and Tech. Expertise

Physical Requirements:
• In-Office Environment:Must be able to work in a busy, crowded, and loud office with frequent distractions and interruptions
• Must be able to collaborate in-person with occasional impromptu in-person meetings
• Office Conditions:Adaptability to typical office conditions, which may include exposure to air conditioning, heating, artificial lighting, and varying noise levels
• Mobility: Ability to sit, stand, reach, twist, stretch, and work at a desk for long stretches. Must be able to occasionally move or lift office items up to 25 pounds
• Hearing Requirements:Hearing must be sufficient or correctable to ensure clear understanding of spoken information, including participating in virtual meetings and phone calls. Use of hearing aids or other assistive devices is acceptable if needed.
• Reading and Writing Proficiency:Ability to read and write in English is essential for processing documents, drafting reports, and following up on necessary actions. Proficiency in written communication is required to handle job-related tasks effectively.
• Vision Requirements:Vision must be adequate or correctable to perform essential job duties, such as reading documents on a computer screen and using other visual tools. Use of corrective lenses or other measures to meet visual requirements is expected if needed.
• Technology Proficiency:Must be proficient in operating a computer and other office productivity tools such as printers, scanners, and collaboration software.
• Effective Communication:Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with team members, clients, and other stakeholders via email, video conferencing, and other in office communication tools.

Compensation:

DOE

If you like wild growth and working in a unique and fun environment, surrounded by positive community, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_title: Emerging and Disruptive Technology Analyst - Senior
job_description:
Vantor is forging the new frontier of spatial intelligence, helping decision makers and operators navigate what’s happening now and shape what’s coming next. Vantor is a place for problem solvers, changemakers, and go-getters—where people are working together to help our customers see the world differently, and in doing so, be seen differently. Come be part of a mission, not just a job, where you can: Shape your own future, build the next big thing, and change the world.

To be eligible for this position, you must be a U.S. Citizen. This position requires an active U.S. Government security clearance, applicants who do not currently hold the required clearance will not be eligible for consideration. Employment for cleared roles is contingent upon verification of clearance status.

Export Control/ITAR: Certain roles may be subject to U.S. export control laws, requiring U.S. person status as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).

Please review the job details below.

This position requires an active U.S. Government Security Clearance at the TS/SCI level with an in-scope CI poly.

We're hiring multiple Emerging and Disruptive Technology Analysts to join our team. In this position you will analyze and assess future technology and its military application(s) by foreign states and non-states. Analysts will support Object-Based Intelligence (OBI) production with a specialized focus on emerging technologies and strategic horizon analysis. Analysts will evaluate the potential national security implications of disruptive technologies—such as artificial intelligence, quantum computing, biotechnology, and autonomous systems—and identify early indicators of technological shifts. This role supports the development of ontologies for structured intelligence integration and contributes to anticipatory analysis that informs long-term defense planning and early warning.

Responsibilities: A day in the life/What the position will be doing:
• Produce assessments projecting the discovery, development, and deployment of advanced technologies and the potential impact to Defense Critical Infrastructure and U.S. nuclear weapons worldwide.
• Produce intelligence supporting the production of the National Security Threat Capabilities Assessment, and threat assessments/global baseline assessments for the Defense Critical Infrastructure Program (DCIP).
• Provide early warning of disruptive developments to ensure Intelligence Community awareness of evolving technological landscapes.
• Conduct all-source analysis to assess the strategic impact of emerging technologies on national security.
• Identify and evaluate potential future threats and opportunities posed by technological developments across global domains.
• Develop and refine ontologies to support OBI production and semantic interoperability within the Defense Intelligence Core Ontology.
• Apply structured analytic techniques (e.g., ACH, scenario analysis, key assumptions check) to assess technology trends and forecast disruptive shifts.
• Monitor global R&D, innovation ecosystems, and technology adoption patterns to inform strategic foresight and early warning.
• Collaborate with data scientists and technologists to integrate advanced analytics, machine learning, and semantic technologies into analytic workflows.
• Document analytic processes to support automation, reproducibility, and integration into knowledge graphs and decision-support systems.
• Produce assessments and briefings tailored to senior decision-makers, highlighting risks, opportunities, and strategic implications of emerging technologies.

Minimum Qualifications
• Must be a US citizen and have an active TS/SCI with CI poly.
• 12 years of experience and an advanced degree
• Experience conducting strategic foresight or horizon scanning in a national security or technology context.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.
• Possesses an expert ability to describe findings and techniques tailored to the intended audience, including technical and nontechnical decision makers.

Preferred Qualifications
• Deep understanding of emerging technology domains (e.g., AI, quantum, biotech, space systems, autonomy).
• Experience supporting OBI production and working with Defense Intelligence ontologies.
• Develops and employs strategies to analyze key issues, draw conclusions from data, and recommend viable solutions to address customer mission needs.
• Ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to complete complex data science projects.
• Demonstrated experience in solving problems with structured and unstructured data.
• Experienced in applying statistical and data visualization skills.
• Strong problem solving skills to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.

Pay Transparency: In support of pay transparency at Vantor, we disclose salary ranges on all U.S. job postings. The successful candidate’s starting pay will fall within the salary range provided below and is determined based on job-related factors, including, but not limited to, the experience, qualifications, knowledge, skills, geographic work location, and market conditions. Candidates with the minimum necessary experience, qualifications, knowledge, and skillsets for the position should not expect to receive the upper end of the pay range.
• The base pay for this position within the Washington, DC metropolitan area is: $118,000.00 - $196,000.00 annually.

For all other states, we use geographic cost of labor as an input to develop market-driven ranges for our roles, and as such, each location where we hire may have a different range.

Business Analysts supporting Electric Transmission Planning are responsible for research, data analysis, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting to support business decision-making, strategy, and operations. They may also be involved in business process improvement, quality control, special projects, and other initiatives.

• This hybrid position works from your remote office and your assigned location based on business needs. The headquarters’ location is flexible and within the PG&E service territory. This position is required to work from a PG&E office 3 days/week.

• Data Analysis: Analysis of LiDAR and vegetation management data. Develop and write code to maintain data models for business purposes.
• Metrics and Reporting: Develops and tracks WMP (Wildfire Mitigation Plan) metrics. Develops and maintains standard, custom, and ad-hoc reports.
• Budgeting & Forecasting: Develops or works with budgets and forecasts.
• Research: Research best practices; develop internal and external benchmarks supporting business decisions.
• Quality Assurance & Business Process Improvement: This position may perform quality assurance and business process improvement activities in support of the business. Activities may include developing, managing, or coordinating performance or quality assessment, business process re-engineering, change management, communication, and training.
• Project Management: Lead projects, determining scope, budget, timeframes, forming teams, assigning tasks, managing resources, responding to periodic audits and requests for data.

Job Responsibilities

• Performs analysis and QA on LiDAR data through Python coding or other coding programs on highly complex data models that have cross-functional impact.
• Applies advanced technical knowledge to broad-ranging issues.
• Develop innovative data solutions to address complex business issues. Presents findings and proposed recommendations to leaders.
• Develop business cases in support of strategy or change initiatives.
• Develop new or revise existing data analysis to predict business outcomes by selecting from various complex variables.
• Manages cross-functional projects or initiatives.

• Organizational, prioritization and multi-tasking skills

job_description:
Position Summary...The role supports the development, administration, and execution of sales compensation programs designed to drive performance across the organization. In this role, you will collaborate closely with Finance, HR, and Total Rewards to calculate commissions and bonuses, maintain accurate compensation documentation, and ensure sales teams receive timely updates on plan changes. You will manage key operational processes such as validating data for commission payouts, maintaining sales team roster and hierarchy records, and supporting quota setting and territory assignments. Additionally, you will prepare quarterly performance reports, respond to compensation-related inquiries, and participate in special projects focused on enhancing compensation tools, processes, and overall sales performance. This position requires strong attention to detail, analytical skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with cross‑functional partners and sales teams.

What you'll do...
• Assist in developing and administrating sales compensation plans while working with Finance to calculate commissions and bonuses.
• Partner with HR and Total Rewards to maintains compensation documentation and ensures timely communication of plan changes to the sales team
• Supporting commission payouts process, validating data and ensuring accuracy
• Responds to compensation-related inquiries from sales team
• Maintaining up-to-date sales team rosters, hierarchies, and compensation plan records
• Supports quota setting and territory assignment and distributing letters for the sales team
• Quarterly reporting as it relates to individual or team performance
• Participate in special projects related to compensation, planning tools, or sales performance initiatives
• Audit payments against plan and communicate with plan stakeholders to address issues
What you’ll bring…
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations, Finance, HR or related field.
• At least 3 years of work experience in a role requiring analytical and strategic skills, such as business analyst, compensation analyst, or business development.
• The ability to communicate findings and make recommendations for improvement clearly and effectively either via presentation or whitepaper.
• The capability to model and simulate improvements to existing business processes, evaluate 'what-if' scenarios, and conduct dry runs to identify and resolve gaps before implementation.
• Aptitude for cross-functional collaboration across various teams, with a strong ability to multitask with a sense of urgency.

job_description:
Principal Data Analyst- Encore

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Analyst at Capital One you will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.

On any given day you will be challenged on three types of work – Innovation, Business Intelligence and Data Management:

Innovation
• Use Open Source/Digital technologies to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data sources and platforms
• Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
• Demonstrate ability to explore and quickly grasp new technologies to progress varied initiatives

Business Intelligence
• Partner with the business to provide consultancy and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
• Drive analysis that provides meaningful insights on business strategies

Data Management
• Drive an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
• Work collaboratively with appropriate Tech teams to manage security mechanisms and data access governance
• Build and execute tools to monitor and report on data quality

Our ideal candidate will have:
• Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• Scripting experience in (Python, R, Spark, and SQL)
• Strong desire and experience with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data)
• Experience utilizing and developing within AWS services

Basic Qualifications:
• Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related quantitative field) plus at least 5 years of experience performing data analytics, or, a Master’s Degree plus at least 3 years performing data analytics with an expectation that required degree will be obtained on or before the scheduled start date.
• At least 3 years of experience working with at least one scripting language
• At least 3 years of experience utilizing a business intelligence visualization tool
• At least 3 years of experience in querying, analyzing and working with data languages and platforms

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• At least 4 years of experience coding in Python, R, Spark, or SQL

job_description:
Description:Business Development & Capture Analyst

Location: Palmdale CA

What You Will Be Doing
Join Lockheed Martin’s legendary Skunk Works® team in Palmdale, CA, and help shape the future of advanced defense technology. As a Business Development Analyst (Level 2), you’ll play a vital role in supporting the Dynamic Targeting and Surveillance Systems portfolio—working alongside experienced capture managers and business leaders to identify, pursue, and win new opportunities. From supporting early-stage strategy development to executing key customer engagements and proposal activities, you’ll be at the center of a fast-paced, mission-driven environment where innovation and teamwork drive success.

Key Responsibilities
- Provide strategy and business development support across the full capture lifecycle—from opportunity shaping to proposal submission and program sustainment.

- Coordinate customer and executive engagements, including visits to Lockheed Martin sites, trade shows, and meetings with senior leaders across government, military, and industry.

- Serve as a pursuit integrator by supporting color team reviews, conducting competitive intelligence, developing internal capture documentation, and preparing customer briefings and materials.

- Maintain accurate portfolio data and documentation within Capture IT systems, including opportunity tracking and New Business Funds (NBF) management.

- Contribute to responses for Requests for Information (RFIs), white papers, and customer presentations that communicate value and innovation.

- Partner with cross-functional teams including Program Management, Visual Communications, and Technical Engineering to ensure cohesive, high-quality deliverables.

- Support planning and logistics for key trade shows, conferences, and stakeholder engagements.

- Travel occasionally to support customer meetings and events.

What’s In It For You
From onsite to remote, we offer flexible work schedules to comprehensive benefits investing in your future and security, Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here.

Who You Are
You are a proactive and detail-oriented professional who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments. You’re passionate about building relationships, supporting strategic initiatives, and contributing to meaningful projects that make an impact. You bring strong organizational skills, clear communication, and the ability to manage multiple priorities with precision. Whether preparing customer materials, coordinating executive visits, or analyzing competitive intelligence, you take pride in delivering excellence. You’re eager to learn from experienced leaders, collaborate across disciplines, and grow your career within Lockheed Martin’s world-renowned Skunk Works organization.

Palmdale, CA This position is in Palmdale, CA Discover Palmdale.
Basic Qualifications:
• Must be a U.S. Citizen – This position is located at a facility that requires special access

• A minimum of 4+ years of experience working special access programs.

• Experience crafting presentations for senior management and customers.

• Experience with USG Special Access Program contracting processes and acquisition strategies.

• Experience working across organizational boundaries and jurisdictions and leading customer meetings and cross-discipline teams in development of customer solutions.

• Must be able to obtain Top Secret Clearance with SAP/SAR/SCI (with CI POLY) accesses.

• Position is full-time in the office and work location is Palmdale, CA. No exceptions.

• Must be able to travel to support customer events.
Desired Skills:
• Knowledge of the Department of War Acquisition Process, Budgeting flow and timelines, and Requirements Development pathway.
• Knowledge of US military organizational construct.
• Familiarity with Lockheed Martin Aeronautics' product line is a requirement.
• Flexibility to quickly adapt to changing business environment and priorities.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Ability to quickly grasp technology concepts and translate their value to customers.
• Ability to utilize interpersonal skills to cope with conflict.
Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Clearance Level: Top Secret with Investigation or CV date within 5 years
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week
Pay Rate: The annual base salary range for this position in California, Massachusetts, and New York (excluding most major metropolitan areas), Colorado, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, Vermont, Washington or Washington DC is $67,000 - $117,990. For states not referenced above, the salary range for this position will reflect the candidate’s final work location. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/ training, key skills as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer.
Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.

Represented full time employees accrue 6.67 hours of Vacation per month; accrue up to 52 hours of sick leave annually; receive at least 96 hours for holidays. Business Systems Analyst - 2002684 (hybrid)

Meet the team

Within Cisco IT, our vision is to be loved as the world’s best IT organization. The CRM Engineering and Transformation Office (CETO) is on a mission to deliver One Team. One Experience. One Cisco through CRM architecture, data frameworks, governance, and AI-driven solutions.

As part of CETO, the Sales Compensation team focuses on delivering a simplified and intuitive Seller and Partner experience. Through Partner Incentives and Metrics, we influence internal sellers and external partners to drive recurring revenue growth and business transformation. You’ll work with a highly collaborative and empowered team of engineers, architects, business analysts, and multi-functional leaders across Sales, Legal, Finance, Business Operations, and Customer/Partner Experience.

Your impact

As a Business System Analyst, you’ll play a pivotal role in designing, building, and scaling next-generation partner incentive platforms that align with Cisco’s strategy and enable growth. In this role, you will:
• Incorporate AI capabilities by interpreting AI-generated insights, demonstrating AI tools for advanced data analysis, and improving strategic decision-making processes.
• Partner with business sponsors, architects, and operational teams to gather, refine, and document requirements.
• Perform data analysis, process simplification, and platform configuration to deliver scalable solutions.
• Collaborate with technical architects and development leads to define and document system capabilities and features.
• Build and run user stories, solution blueprints, and functional testing (including regression and progression automation).
• Solve and resolve end-user, partner, and support team issues.
• Conduct post-project evaluations to identify improvements and growth opportunities.
• Assess risks, dependencies, and downstream impacts while reporting project status to team members.
• Apply Agile methodologies, standards, and documentation practices for automation and system maintenance.

Minimum qualifications :
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant Engineering field with strong Computer Science fundamentals and 5+ years of professional experience in designing and building applications, OR
• Master’s degree in Computer Science or relevant Engineering field with strong Computer Science fundamentals and 2+ years of professional experience in designing and building applications.
• Hands-on experience with big data in Oracle and Snowflake.
• Experience with incentive management, including business processes, data, and architectural concepts related to partner compensation models.
• Familiarity with AI concepts, tools, and their application in business analysis.
• Ability to interpret and validate AI-generated data and recommendations.

Preferred qualifications :
• Experience with Varicent ICM and GenAI capabilities.
• Good understanding of N-Tier architecture concepts and their influence on build, development, and deployment.
• Validated experience in incubating, conceptualizing, planning, crafting, and leading ground-breaking projects.
• Strong knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
• Superb communication, organizational, and collaboration skills to thrive in a team-driven environment.

At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint. Simply put – we power the future.

Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.

We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

• 80 hours of sick time off provided on hire date and each January 1st thereafter, and up to 80 hours of unused sick time carried forward from one calendar year to the next
• Additional paid time away may be requested to deal with critical or emergency issues for family members

For non-sales roles, employees are also eligible to earn annual bonuses subject to Cisco’s policies.

• .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;
• 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;
• 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay 0% up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
